intro: Psychotria brevipaniculata, commonly known as the short-bracted Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, red berries that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant contains various alkaloids, which have been studied for their potential pharmacological properties.
